Pre-Game Insights: Orlando Magic (20-15, fourth in the Eastern Conference) vs. Toronto Raptors (8-26, 13th in the Eastern Conference).
Orlando visits Toronto looking to end its three-game road slide.
The Raptors are 5-15 against Eastern Conference opponents.
Toronto is 3-19 against opponents with a winning record.
The Magic are 16-10 in Eastern Conference play.
Orlando is at the bottom of the league shooting 30.6% from 3-point range.
The Raptors are shooting 46.2% from the field this season, 0.2 percentage points lower than the 46.4% the Magic allow to opponents.
The Magic's 44.8% shooting percentage from the field this season is 2.3 percentage points lower than the Raptors have given up to their opponents (47.1%).
RJ Barrett is averaging 23.4 points, 6.8 rebounds and 6.2 assists for the Raptors.
Goga Bitadze is scoring 9.9 points per game and averaging 8.3 rebounds for the Magic.

Raptors: 1-9 in their last 10 games, averaging 109.6 points, 41.8 rebounds, 28.6 assists, 7.5 steals and 4.2 blocks per game while shooting 45.8% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 123.2 points per game.

Magic: 4-6 in their last 10 games, averaging 101.4 points, 40.2 rebounds, 21.7 assists, 9.6 steals and 6.1 blocks per game while shooting 43.8% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 105.0 points.
Raptors injuries: Bruce Brown (day to day, knee), RJ Barrett (day to day, illness).
Magic injuries: Paolo Banchero (out, oblique), Anthony Black (day to day, back), Franz Wagner (out, oblique), Moritz Wagner (out for season, knee), Trevelin Queen (day to day, illness).
